text.value: How many breaths were counted during the minute?
The child does not have fast breathing
This person does not have fast breathing
Press timer and count the number of breaths for a full 60 seconds
How long has this cough lasted?
Is bleeding from nose, mouth, skin, other sites?
Is unable to drink or eat anything?
Does feel hot or unusually cold?
Is there blood in the diarrhea?
How many stools did have in the last 24 hours?
How long has the diarrhea lasted?
Has had 3 or more loose stools in the last 24 hours?
Use your thermometer to take the patient's temperature
Do the Malaria Rapid Diagnostic Test (mRDT)
How long has the fever lasted?
Why was a malaria test not done?
Have you referred for malaria test?
What was the Malaria test result?
Temperature has to be between 34 and 42
Use your MUAC strap to take the child's MUAC
What is the color of the MUAC strap?
Does have swelling of both feet?
is below 2 months. Have you referred them to the health facility for danger signs management?
You cannot do an assessment for this age. If you do not want to refer for danger signs, use the other appropriate forms like immunization for other actions
Remember to follow up in 3 days
Greet the patient, then ask and look for danger signs. Is improving?
Date must be within the next 7 days
When will you follow up again with ?
Check if the patient is taking the medicine correctly. Advise that continue taking the medicine as recommended.
Select a person from the list
Be sure you submit to complete this action
Ask to see again in 3 days and 6 days in follow up visits even if they improve
Explain why the sick needs to go to the health facility.
For any sick person who can drink, advice to give more fluids and continue feeding or breastfeeding.
Advice to keep the person warm if they does not feel hot on touch.
If the sick has fever, give first dose of Paracetamol and ask the care giver to remove extra clothing.
If convulsing now, show care giver how to position the person. Do not put any object in the mouth.
Support transportation and help solve other difficulties in referral.
Advise caregiver to increase fluids, to continue exclusive breastfeeding or to continue breastfeeding and feeding the child if child is not on exclusive breastfeeding
Help the caregiver give the first dose now.
Advise caregiver to increase fluids, to continue exclusive breastfeeding or to continue breastfeeding and feeding the child if child is not on exclusive breastfeeding.
Advise caregiver not to give any drugs to the child for this condition. Cough medicines may contain harmful ingredients, and are expensive.

Advice caregiver to go to health facility or if not possible return if the child:
  • - does not eat, or drink, breastfeed
  • - develops fast breathing/difficult breathing
  • - has blood in the stool
  • - any sign that the child is getting sicker
Advice caregiver on use of a bednet (ITN)
Help the caregiver give the child ORS solution in front of you until child is no longer thirsty
Advise caregiver to increase fluids, to continue exclusive breastfeeding or to continue breastfeeding and feeding the child if child is not on exclusive breastfeeding"
Give caregiver 4 packets of half litre (500ml sachet) ORS to take home

Advice caregiver to go to health facility or if not possible return if the child: does not eat, or drink, breastfeed, develops fast breathing/difficult breathing or has blood in the stool or any sign that the child is getting sicker
Show the caregiver how to prepare the ORS solution
Help caregiver to give first dose now
Advice caregiver on use of a bednet (ITN)

For Children not on exclusive breastfeeding advice caregiver to:

  1. Breast feed more frequently and for longer periods at each feeding

  2. Continue giving extra fluids until diarrhea stops

Encourage caregiver to give small sips of ORS frequently from a cup. If the child vomits, wait for 10 minutes, then continue giving fluids, but more slowly. If the child can take more, encourage the caregiver to continue giving.
Emphasize that it is important to give the Zinc for the full ten days,even if the Diarrhea stops.
Help the caregiver give the first dose now

Advice caregiver to go to health facility or if not possible return if the child: does not eat, or drink, breastfeed, develops fast breathing/difficult breathing or has blood in the stool or any sign that the child is getting sicker
Advise caregiver to increase fluids, to continue exclusive breastfeeding or to continue breastfeeding and feeding the child if child is not on exclusive breastfeeding
Advice caregiver on use of a bednet (ITN)
Help the caregiver give the first dose now.
Advise caregiver to increase fluids, to continue exclusive breastfeeding or to continue breastfeeding and feeding the child if child is not on exclusive breastfeeding
Advice caregiver on use of a bednet (ITN)
Advise caregiver to give 2nd dose after 8 hrs and to give dose twice daily for 2 more days

Advice caregiver to go to health facility or if not possible return if the child: does not eat, or drink, breastfeed, develops fast breathing/difficult breathing or has blood in the stool or any sign that the child is getting sicker
Help the caregiver give the first dose now.
Advise caregiver to increase fluids, to continue exclusive breastfeeding or to continue breastfeeding and feeding the child if child is not on exclusive breastfeeding
Advise caregiver to increase fluids, to continue exclusive breastfeeding or to continue breastfeeding and feeding the child if child is not on exclusive breastfeeding

Advice caregiver to go to health facility or if not possible return if the child: does not eat, or drink, breastfeed, develops fast breathing/difficult breathing or has blood in the stool or any sign that the child is getting sicker
Advice caregiver on use of a bednet (ITN)
Help the caregiver give the first dose now
Advise caregiver to increase fluids, to continue exclusive breastfeeding or to continue breastfeeding and feeding the child if child is not on exclusive breastfeeding
Advice caregiver on use of a bednet (ITN)
Help the caregiver give the first dose now

Advice caregiver to go to health facility or if not possible return if the child: does not eat, or drink, breastfeed, develops fast breathing/difficult breathing or has blood in the stool or any sign that the child is getting sicker
Advice caregiver on use of a bednet (ITN)
Have you referred to the health facility?
Refer urgently to Health facility
Refer child to a health facility for malaria test
Soothe the throat and relieve the cough with a safe remedy, warm fluids, lemon tea, tea with honey, or breast milk.
Soothe the throat and relieve the cough with breastfeeding only.
Treat with ORS 5 to 10 tablespoonfuls : at least 1/2 cup after every loose stool Total 4 sachets
Treat with ORS 10 to 20 tablespoonfuls:at least 1/2 cup after every loose stool Total 4 sachets
Treat with Zinc 1/2 tablet 1 times a day For 10 days Total 5 tabs
Treat with Zinc 1 tablet 1 times a day For 10 days Total 10 tabs
Treat with Paracetamol 500mg 1/4 tablet 3 times a day For 5 days Total 5 tabs
Treat with Paracetamol 500mg 1/4 tablet 3 times a day For 5 days Total 5 tabs
Treat with AL -1/2 tablet 2 times a day For 3 days Total 3 tabs
Treat with AL 1 tablet 2 times a day For 3 days Total 6 tabs
Treat with AL 2 tablets 2 times a day For 3 days Total 12 tabs
Treat with Paracetamol 500mg 1/4 tablet 3 times a day For 5 days Total 5 tabs
Treat with Paracetamol 500mg 1/4 tablet 3 times a day For 5 days Total 5 tabs
Counsel caregiver on feeding or refer for supplementary feeding program, if available
Treat with Amoxicillin tablet 250mg 1 tablet 2 times a day For 5 days Total 10 tabs
Treat with Amoxicillin tablet 250mg 2 tablets 2 times a day For 5 days Total 20 tabs
Treat with Amoxicillin syrup-125mg/5mls or 1 teaspoonful 1 tablespoon 2 times a day For 5 days Total 5 tabs
Treat with Amoxicillin syrup - 125mg/5mls or 1 teaspoonful 2 tablespoons 2 times a day For 5 days Total 5 tabs

bind.calculate: if( selected( /child_assessment/group_assessment/g_two_mo_assessment/two_mo_referred , 'yes') or selected( /child_assessment/group_assessment/g_danger_signs_screening/danger_signs_sleepy , 'yes') or selected( /child_assessment/group_assessment/g_danger_signs_screening/danger_signs_less_active , 'yes') or selected( /child_assessment/group_assessment/g_danger_signs_screening/danger_signs_yellow , 'yes') or selected( /child_assessment/group_assessment/g_danger_signs_screening/danger_signs_hot_cold , 'yes') or selected( /child_assessment/group_assessment/g_danger_signs_screening/danger_signs_bleeding , 'yes') or selected( /child_assessment/group_assessment/g_danger_signs_screening/danger_signs_vomit , 'yes') or selected( /child_assessment/group_assessment/g_danger_signs_screening/danger_signs_chest , 'yes') or selected( /child_assessment/group_assessment/g_danger_signs_screening/danger_signs_drink , 'yes') or selected( /child_assessment/group_assessment/g_danger_signs_screening/danger_signs_breath , 'yes') ,"yes", "no" )

if( selected( /child_assessment/group_assessment/g_malaria/malaria_fever_length , '7') or selected( /child_assessment/group_assessment/g_malaria/malaria_fever_length , '14') or selected( /child_assessment/group_assessment/g_malaria/malaria_results , 'not_done') or selected( /child_assessment/group_assessment/g_cough/cough_time , '14') or selected( /child_assessment/group_assessment/g_diarrhea/diarrhea_last , '14') or selected( /child_assessment/group_assessment/g_diarrhea/diarrhea_blood , 'yes') or selected( /child_assessment/fast_breathing_child , 'yes') or selected( /child_assessment/group_assessment/g_malnutrition/malnutrition_muac_color , 'red') or selected( /child_assessment/group_assessment/g_malnutrition/malnutrition_muac_color , 'yellow') or selected( /child_assessment/group_assessment/g_malnutrition/malnutrition_swollen_feet , 'yes') ,"yes", "no" )

if( selected( /child_assessment/any_danger , 'yes') or selected( /child_assessment/group_assessment/g_malaria/malaria_fever_rash , 'yes') or selected( /child_assessment/group_assessment/g_malaria/malaria_referred , 'yes') or selected( /child_assessment/fast_breathing_child , 'yes') or selected( /child_assessment/fast_breathing_person , 'yes') or selected( /child_assessment/group_assessment/g_two_mo_assessment/two_mo_referred , 'yes') ,"yes", "no" )

if( selected( /child_assessment/any_danger , 'no') and /child_assessment/group_assessment/g_malaria/malaria_fever_length > 0 and /child_assessment/group_assessment/g_malaria/malaria_fever_length < 7 and not(selected( /child_assessment/group_assessment/g_malaria/malaria_results , 'positive')) ,"yes", "no" )

bind.relevant: selected( /child_assessment/group_assessment/g_malaria/malaria_fever_rash , 'yes') or selected( /child_assessment/group_assessment/g_malaria/malaria_referred , 'yes') or selected( /child_assessment/fast_breathing_child , 'yes') or selected( /child_assessment/fast_breathing_person , 'yes') or selected( /child_assessment/group_assessment/g_two_mo_assessment/two_mo_referred , 'yes')

selected( /child_assessment/any_danger , 'no') and ( selected( /child_assessment/group_assessment/g_cough/cough_yes_no , 'yes') or selected( /child_assessment/group_assessment/g_diarrhea/diarrhea_yes_no , 'yes') or selected( /child_assessment/group_assessment/g_malaria/malaria_results , 'positive') )
